content:
Is it normal to have doc-gen4 stuck for a while, yielding tons of warnings at the end each time I run the document generation?

image.png

Yes, doc-gen tries to delaborat the equations every declaration that has equations so that it can show them to you but many declarations are too big so it times out doing that. And occasionally it will also find a bug in equation generation while doing that as is the case with assert.

And the reason it "hangs for a while" is that in parallel to generating docs for your project it uses one lake task to generate docs for the compiler/built in library and that is usually quite big so it takes a big. If you generate docs for a large project like mathlib where running doc-gen on the library itself is faster than on the compiler you dont notice it
Schrodinger ZHU Yifan has marked this topic as resolved.
